case_name: Initial Order for Sandvine Corporation under the CCAA
outcome_details: The court granted an initial order for Sandvine Corporation and related entities to undergo restructuring under the CCAA, including a stay of proceedings, appointment of a monitor, approval of interim financing, and other related reliefs.
decision_factors: The need for restructuring due to insolvency and liquidity issues
The interconnected global operations of Sandvine
The need to maintain ongoing business operations without disruption
The necessity of cross-border recognition under Chapter 15 of the US Bankruptcy Code
cited_cases: Bed Bath & Beyond Canada Limited (Re), 2023 ONSC 1014
Ted Baker Canada Inc. et al (Re), 2024 ONSC
summary: The court ruled in favor of Sandvine Corporation's application for an initial order under the Companiesâ€™ Creditors Arrangement Act (CCAA). This order includes a stay of proceedings, appointment of KSV Restructuring Inc. as Monitor, approval of a debtor-in-possession financing facility, authorization to recognize Canadian restructuring proceedings in US courts under Chapter 15 of the US Bankruptcy Code, and other related reliefs to ensure the stability and continuation of Sandvine's operations during restructuring.
